private_information: I can move only disks A B C D E F G H
I must only move a disk that is currently the top disk on some peg
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is: left peg top-to-bottom B E F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg top-to-bottom D, right peg top-to-bottom A C

private_information: I can move only disks I J K L M N O
I must only move a disk that is currently the top disk on some peg
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is: left peg top-to-bottom B E F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg top-to-bottom D, right peg top-to-bottom A C

private_information: I can integrate the move proposals of agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a unified PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner
I must ensure agent move assignments remain distinct and legal under Tower of Hanoi rules
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent move lists and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that encodes the two-agent move constraints and the target configuration

public_information: There are three pegs named left middle right
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O and middle peg empty and right peg empty
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom B E F G H I J K L M N O middle peg top-to-bottom D right peg top-to-bottom A C
Tower of Hanoi rules: only the top disk of a peg may be moved and no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A B C D E F G H and agent_2 may move only disks I J K L M N O

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks. You may move only disks A B C D E F G H. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and must refer only to disks you can move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. Only include moves that you are allowed to perform and that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules. Keep the move list minimal and sufficient given your knowledge.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks. You may move only disks I J K L M N O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and must refer only to disks you can move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. Only include moves that you are allowed to perform and that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules. Keep the move list minimal and sufficient given your knowledge.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and must integrate the move lists from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward planner. The PDDL should encode three pegs, the 15 labeled disks, the Tower of Hanoi rules, and the constraint that only agent_1 can execute actions that move disks A B C D E F G H and only agent_2 can execute actions that move disks I J K L M N O. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions for agent_1 and agent_2 are distinct and the encoding is compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You receive two ordered move lists: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Use the public environment description: {environment->public_information}. Your task is to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the initial state and the goal configuration and that respect the agent disk movement restrictions. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing actions with agent identifiers where appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward solver in required features and style.
